embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

replies.body:
That moment when you killed more elder drakes than ocean drakes.

http://puu.sh/sOJyA/d3d8253471.png

when we were picking out what to show on the dragon portion of the site, everyone told me 'don't bother showing least killed drake, it's always going to be elder' but I knew SOMEONE would have something else. thank you for giving me the proof :D
Elder is the only dragon guaranteed to spawn.
Not true, i've had games where one air drake spawned and was never touched, so no elder was ever spawned. Also Elder only spawns after a certain time so short games will never see them.
i think he means that with every other dragon its a 1/4 chance but once u hit the 30 min marker elder with have 100% chance of spawning
Is it really 1/4? I hardly see flame drake... Its always mountain or cloud.
Really depends on luck. Ive had a game where we got 3 fires in a row. Twas a good game.
35 minute.

It's totally skewed since junglers will have the most even spread for last hitting more reliably, but other roles will only get this last hit kill stat when the jungler allows it or if they do it without the smite.
I'm pretty sure this doesn't count last hitting, just your team killing the dragon.
Yup this is it! It's team based for dragon kills :)

Cloud drake is such a good dragon buff for someone like me who likes to roam with immobile mages.

Literally 10% only, least killed.

Yeah of course I want mountain drake over something like cloud or ocean, who doesn't love taking towers a few seconds faster as a champion that can siege them constantly

Almost half of my dragon kills have been Ocean... how the hell did you get more Elder dragons than Ocean...?
the champs he plays generally think ocean is worth less than cloud, so he has less incentive to get them. prolly plays fast champs that dont care for sustain

So you killed more elders than oceans and more clouds overall. It's something.

I guess you take the drakes the enemy team lets you get lol

Mountain Drake is tied with cloud drake for me though :( 

 https://puu.sh/sPmCR/b9b3660038.png


Both of them are 31% but i guess it said Cloud drake cause it starts with a C {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
I had ocean and earth both at 25% but Ocean was my most killed, I guess it isn't alphabetical order.
Where are these stats from?

> [{quoted}](name=Rito CCMustang,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=754xKhqx,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-12-14T05:45:00.340+0000)
>
> Where are these stats from?

https://review2016.na.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/year-in-review/personal-landing
https://media.giphy.com/media/10uct1aSFT7QiY/giphy.gif
Not surprisingly, my most-killed drake is Cloud, which also happens to be the one that I personally prefer to have the most.
Well does Cloud just spawn more often? It's the least important, arguably, so why is it killed the most?

I'd say the order is Infernal > Cloud > Earth > Ocean

Cloud is so good for making actual strategic plays.

Also, there are WAAAAY more than enough games that the spawn rate for each E drag is equal. Perhaps if only 10 games were played this would be valid argument, but there are millions. Each week.

Infernal spawns the least, doesn't it? 

Some would argue that its the most powerful of the 4, with Mountain being a close second or equal.
pretty sure all 4 dragons have an equal probability to spawn

> [{quoted}](name=Paleo Electro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=754xKhqx,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2016-12-14T07:42:08.738+0000)
> 
> Some would argue that its the most powerful of the 4, with Mountain being a close second or equal.

Mountain is way more powerful than Infernal in my opinion. I have a theory that the type of Drake someone likes tells you a lot about them as a player.

People that like Infernal are probably the ones that like to fight a lot. They are the ones that you will likely find chasing a 2 hp Amumu all the way across the map instead of taking a tower or pushing a lane. They are probably the ones who's solution to every problem is to group and fight.

People like me who love to split-push every chance they get like Mountain Drake. Players like me absolutely hate the idea of grouping constantly for no reason and would rather spend half the game ignoring their team while constantly pushing one lane. We don't care much about our KDA's so long as we are getting towers. We are the kind of players that think a death for a tower or an inhibitor is a good trade.

People that like Cloud drake probably main champs like Shaco or other assassins like Leblanc and Akali and love to roam about getting picks. Players like this never like to farm and they tend to roam from lane every chance they get even if it means only having 20 CS by 10 minutes. These players primary source of income is kills and they tend to have high KDAs or they feed a lot. Yasuo mains might like this Drake too.

People who love to spam abilities a lot might like Ocean Drake. Ziggs mains, Lux mains, Sona mains come to mind.
Terrible assertions tbh

>
> Terrible assertions tbh

I love speculating on shit like this. Sue me.

We don't care much about our KDA's so long as we are getting towers. We are the kind of players that think a death for a tower or an inhibitor is a good trade.


ALL OF MY YES. As a Yorick i say this: Towers>Kills. Nexus>Teamfight. Inhib>Death. 
(Also the rift herald is the icing on the cake, seriously i wonder if they'll nerf the damage from it)

> [{quoted}](name=Arthur o3o,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=754xKhqx,comment-id=00080000000000010002,timestamp=2016-12-14T22:11:10.367+0000)

OMG Rift Herald. So fuckin broken. The damage allows you win trades very easily as a splitpusher. In combination with Mountain Drakes, they nuke towers.

Don't forget about banner of command. The change to it is DIVINE. 

Make the cannon minion tank 15 shots from tower. Summon maiden. Have herald. Have sheen. 

Towers? What are those? (Especially with the delicious mountain drakes <3)

> [{quoted}](name=Arthur o3o,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=754xKhqx,comment-id=0008000000000001000200000000,timestamp=2016-12-14T22:21:59.736+0000)

> Make the cannon minion tank 15 shots from tower. Summon maiden. Have herald. Have sheen. 
> 
> Towers? What are those? (Especially with the delicious mountain drakes <3)

I played against a Yorick that did something similar once. Talk about frustrating. Took the whole lane from 1st tower to inhibitor in no time at all. Next time I play Nasus, I'm gonna do some shit like that.

Yorick is really underappreciated. Just the fact that I'm the top 7th yorick on NA by mastery ranking right now is sad. Because in season 7 i'm currently in bronze III (Started in bronze VI, Yorick's almost free wins, people have NO IDEA how to react to split push because every game it's just KILLS KILLS KILLS). As for a simple tip. If you want a Yorick to lose his mind, just play Riven. Mobility+Stuns+High burst (And constant DPS after that) really /really/ wrecks Yorick's face.  Can't learn to play vs them as I either face someone who has mechanical knowledge of a potato, or a second boxbox in the making. Just can't find a riven player to learn how to yorick vs QQ

I personally love the cloud drake not so much for roaming, but for initiating.
For assassins, that extra speed outside of combat can be the difference between closing the gap on an enemy so you can combo them, and them escaping.
For tanks/divers, the same is true, except in their case it's trying to close the gap on the entire enemy team to initiate, rather than one individual player.  Same concept, slightly different execution.

I wouldn't say the Cloud dragon is the least important dragon, at least not during the early game. Many people understimate how powerful early movement speed can be (especially because you have no boots yet) even though it is only out of combat. It allows you to better defend towers, contest objectives, and even to have a better chance of escaping sucessfully from an enemy (or enemies) that are chasing you.

I actually consider Cloud to be stronger than the Infernal dragon early, because you don't have enough AD or AP to take advantage of the Infernal bonuses, but you don't have enough movement speed so the Cloud dragon movement speed is pretty useful (once you have enough movement speed from boots, the Cloud Dragon movement speed will not stack as well).

Cloud is actually the best hands down. The other three are all about equal with their own niches. Earth is the one for helping you to a backdoor upset, fire can tip the edge in a team fight, water can seal the deal in extended skirmishin and posturing for an advantage.

I'd rate the dragons Cloud > Fire = Earth = Water personally.

Fuck that champion.

http://puu.sh/sOZGL/4639e4ff23.jpg

And I'm a jg/Zac main. Going to his lane was a death trap.
I'm a Lux main, and was surprised to see that I was most killed by Lux. I always felt like I could beat them easily since I knew the champion well, but I guess I was lying to myself.
Thats what I said lol

Obviously at the time when Elder Dragon spawns, a team wipe most likely will mean defeat. 

Baron can be worth risking it; Elder Dragon is not.

At least, that is how I see it.
I would have thought Infernal would be higher priority than Cloud.
its different for everyone isn't it? for me infernal was the most taken
For me its always ocean > cloud > infernal> earth because I play roaming mages normally
Ocean got nerfed. Def used to be the best though.

I know it got nerfed but for me I like it because I play roaming mid laners, so out of combat effects are really helpful for me. With different characters I try to get different dragons, but overall I favor ocean and cloud.
Same here strange....{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
Where's the data from?
https://review2016.na.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/year-in-review/personal-stats
Why do you go for Wind so much lmao
Because it is an extremely important Drake, it gives you extra move speed, which could save your whole team's life when running from a fight, or chasing.
